net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.graphics

Class ColorX

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Color
      • net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.graphics.ColorX
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ColorX>

    public class ColorX
extends java.awt.Color
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ColorX>
    An extension of Java's own Color class, which contains constants for all defined CSS3 colors, as well as a set of methods for unique color modifications that build upon Java's Color.brighter() and Color.darker().
    Since:
    April 7, 2015, 7:28:12 PM
    Author:
    Christian Bryce Alexander
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorX(float r, float g, float b)
      Creates a ColorX from the specified floating point red, green, and blue channels between 0f and 1f, with a default alpha of 1f.

      Creates a ColorX from the specified floating point alpha, red, green, and blue channels between 0f and 1f.

      Creates a ColorX from the specified ARGB integer value.

      Creates a ColorX from the specified integer red, green, and blue channels between 0 and 255, with a default alpha of 255.

      • ofLightness

        public int ofLightness(float lightness)
        Gets the integer value of this ColorX as if its lightness were altered. Negative lightness tends towards full black (0xff000000), whereas positive lightness tends towards full white (0xffffffff).
        Parameters:
        lightness - The lightness of the new color
        Returns:
        The value of this ColorX with its lightness altered

      • colorOfLightness

        public ColorX colorOfLightness(float lightness)
        Parameters:
        lightness - The lightness of the new color
        Returns:
        A new instance of ColorX, with its values based on ofLightness(float)

      • ofSaturation

        public int ofSaturation(float saturation)
        Gets the integer value of this ColorX as if its saturation were altered. Negative saturation tends towards average gray ((r + g + b) / 3), whereas positive saturation tends towards the nearest extreme (0 or 255).
        Parameters:
        saturation - The saturation of the new color
        Returns:
        The value of this ColorX with its saturation altered

      • colorOfSaturation

        public ColorX colorOfSaturation(float saturation)
        Parameters:
        saturation - The saturation of the new color
        Returns:
        A new instance of ColorX, with its values based on ofSaturation(float)

      • ofInversion

        public int ofInversion(float factor)
        Gets the integer value of this ColorX as if its values were tending toward inversion. A factor of 0f means no inversion. A factor of 1f means full inversion. Any other factor tends towards the inverted values.
        Parameters:
        factor - The inversion of the new color's values
        Returns:
        The value of this ColorX with its values slightly inverted

      • colorOfInversion

        public ColorX colorOfInversion(float factor)
        Parameters:
        factor - The inversion of the new color's values
        Returns:
        A new instance of ColorX, with its values based on ofInversion(float)

      • inverted

        public int inverted()
        Gets the integer value of this ColorX as if its values were fully inverted.
        Returns:
        The inverse value of this ColorX

      • invertedColorX

        public ColorX invertedColorX()
        Returns:
        A new instance of ColorX, with its values based on inverted()

        public int ofAdjustment(float r,
                        float g,
                        float b)
        Gets the integer value of this ColorX as if its values were adjusted based on the specified percentages.
        Parameters:
        r - The percentage of red to use
        g - The percentage of green to use
        b - The percentage of blue to use
        Returns:
        The adjusted value of this ColorX
